instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.P5V_S3: What is P5V_S3? This is a typo of PP5V_S3 When you see P5V_S3, assume they meant to type PP5V_S3.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.C1802: What is C1802? Capacitor to ground on PCH_SRTCRST_L on machines from 2009-2012, PCH_SRTCRST_L needs to be high for PCH to not be in RTC reset mode, this capacitor can become corroded or leaky and result in this signal being pulled low. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: 3115 No <SIGNAL>P5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Diode readings around <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> look good but tried replacing it. PPBUS G3H is 12.65V. S5 PGood is 3V, SMC PM G2 EN is present. NO 5v 3v3 REG EN. Did a check with FLIR just in case and that isn't picking up anything hot. Multiple liquid contact areas but not seeing anything with serious corrosion and found some parts knocked off and replaced those.

threads.title: 3115 No <SIGNAL>P5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
" NO 5v 3v3 REG EN
-----------
3 - 3.3V"
???

If you consider to write correctly a signal name, will be more easy to avoid confusions.

threads.title: 3115 No <SIGNAL>P5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I had typed it correctly. Previously had 0V when checking... maybe didnt have good contacts. What is needed to enable <SIGNAL>P5V_S3</SIGNAL>... pin 2 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7221</TRANSISTOR> should be low, correct? it is 3.4V. <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is not present which I believe is needed to get <SIGNAL>P5V_S3</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: 3115 No <SIGNAL>P5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"I had typed it correctly"
Zoom in and check if isn't <SIGNAL>P5V3V3_REG_EN</SIGNAL> instead!!!

S3 state is enabled by <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> signal.
You need to get <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> first.

threads.title: 3115 No <SIGNAL>P5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I verified both <SIGNAL>P5V3V3_REG_EN</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>5V3V3_REG_EN</SIGNAL> are present if that is what you mean so I apparently didn't get an accurate measurement previously or it may have restored after some work on the board. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> is present

threads.title: 3115 No <SIGNAL>P5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I"m an idiot I don't know why I didn't follow same startup sequence as the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/1466/1398 boards. 0V at <CAPACITOR>C1802</CAPACITOR>/3 and realized I was missing <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> near there but it was present on <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> the pass through line was damaged next to <CAPACITOR>C2233</CAPACITOR> so jumpered and now I'm getting a short fan spin and stopping.

threads.title: 3115 No <SIGNAL>P5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: SMC bypass allows the board to boot.

threads.title: 3115 No <SIGNAL>P5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Then you have problems with some I/V sensor.
Check first resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: 3115 No <SIGNAL>P5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Yeah I checked those and the ISL resistances there checked out. Investigated ISENSE and VSENSE components around the SMC during SMC bypass and couldnt find anything. Reflowed SMC with pressure and board now starts and boots after cool off.

threads.title: 3115 No <SIGNAL>P5V_S3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Then reball it; avoid to get it back in warranty.
It had bad solders for some sensor lines.
